introduction:
*own it own it own it own it...*
...
Ah, apologies, I was not expecting such esteemed guests this hour; no matter, we shall make time. I, King Mithradates IV, welcome you to the Kingdom of Pontus...
...
You haven't heard of my prestigious bloodline? Ah, remind me, did you say you were Persian or Greek?
neutralHello: What might I do for you friend...?
hateHello: Oh my Gods... I'm speechless. Absolutely dumbfounded. What could drive so many foreigners to butcher innocent people, their friends, neighbors, countrymen, just because they spoke a similar tongue to your's? I'm sorry beyond words, truly. We've had a couple squabbles in the past, but you must've understood, I mean you can't have thought me so cruel or insane that I could let stand such an atrocity; and by those that acted as if they were your allies, I mean I don't even feel like I know this peninsula now. I promise I'll do everything I can to see these regional ethnic massacres end at once. A tragedy, really. My deepest condolences.
tradeRequest: For you, I offer the riches of the Silk Road.

cities: Now Everybody Knows What I Am And I CanNeverLiveItDown

name: Caria
declaringWar: War is what men were made for, no point in fighting it.
defeated:
I know we've had our differences, but I really need you to do me a solid once I'm gone. Please take care of my sister: she's always been a very sentimental person who's prone to despair, and I just want to make sure she gets over my death. Make sure she doesn't do anything extreme or unhealthy while she copes, and avoid promoting such behavior by romanticizing that stuff; oh and don't let her go see tragedies. Thanks. 

...The what of Halicarnassus?
introduction: Welcome to Caria, I am the ruler of this land Mausoleus.
hateHello: You're looking down on me aren't you?
tradeRequest: You need fighting men? Because Karian mercenaries are some of the fighters in the  Mediterranean You know it's all the same old shit.

attacked: I understand you're upset about your children and all, but was he really that bad of a cook?

Egads; as with Attis Cybele has seen to punish me for my pride, my prestige, by sending chaos and madness to destroy Phrygia.

introduction: I welcome you foreigner, as King Midas of Phrygia, though I'm sure my reputation precedes me.
name: Phrygia
neutralHello: Welcome, foreign dignitary. What is it you've come to offer?
startIntroPart1: I find the Phrygians and Thracians fascinating. They were the platonic ideal of barbarians, but still made time for music fashion and wine, when the latter were arguably the best warriors of antiquity. That's it.
tradeRequest: I assure you, a handshake is all that it's gonna take for us to make you a fabulous amount of wealth.

attacked:
You people never learn. Isauria is ours, and soon your sheep will be too. 
I'd see our cities burned to ash before submitting it to you.
declaringWar: I grow sick of you foreigners looking down on us. I think I will take your throne and look down upon you.
hateHello: I'll rip your fucking head off.
introduction:
Hail. We are the Isaurians; last of the true Anatolians, unconquered by Persia, unbroken by Macedon, a people as strong as uncompromising as the mountains we inhabit. 
Diplomacy is over.
name: Isauria
startIntroPart1:
They always ask us Isauria, but nobody ever asks Howsauria... 
The Byzantine Empire truly is like living in a society...
tradeRequest: This once, we are willing to negotiate a deal. And not for the purpose of distraction while we steal your sheep.
uniques: [+50]% Strength for cities <with [1] to [6] neighboring [Mountain] tiles>
[+25]% Strength decreasing with distance from the capital <when fighting units from a Civilization with more Cities than you> <for [Melee] units>
[+1 Production] from [Mountain] tiles [in all cities]
[+1 Food] from [Mountain] tiles [in all cities] <when at war>
Land units may cross [Mountain] tiles after the first [Great General] is earned
uniqueText: +1 [Production] from Mountain tiles, plus +1 [Production] +1 [Food] when at war. +33% Strength for Melee units decreasing with distance from the capital when fighting larger civilizations. +50% Strength for cities next to a mountain.

attacked: An opportunity to fight beside true friends is the best suprise we could've asked for.
declaringWar: We've built cities and learned Greek, but our blood is Thracian. Seems you've forgotten that, so we'll remind you.
defeated: My final decree, I bequeath my kingdom to Rome, and to Julius Caesar, Queen of Bithynia.
hateHello: I'm not too old to chop you barbarians down a few pegs.
introduction: Ave, you stand before King Nicomedes IV of Bithynia, which, funnily enough, is also the name of this city. Now please, have some wine before you go.
name: Bithynia
startIntroPart1: Imagine living and dying in service of your country and people, and they end up primarily remembered for one of their kings, specifically for being rumored to have railed some guy by his political enemies. Anyways i don't remember how people talk sorry
tradeRequest: Know that trade strengthens all peoples involved.
